Also known as Gadorost. Dug into the side of the Mindolluin, it houses many cells where common folk are held after judgement is passed.

Also known as Tham Baudh, the main courthouse of the city. It is where magistrates pass judgement against all but the highest lords in the city.

Also known as Sammath Oston, it contains offices of city clerks, heralds, records-keepers, and so forth. It is the heart that keeps Minas Tirith alive.

Also known as Rond Anor, the great meeting-hall of Minas Tirith. It is where the city councilors hold court, and high magistrates hold trials for prominent citizens or the highest of crimes.
